caption: 🎉 That’s a wrap on our donation event! Huge thanks to everyone who has donated, and a shoutout to St. Michael’s College for collaborating with us!🙌
A kind reminder to people who had signed up to run elections: Please submit your campaign videos to s4s.utsg@gmail.com before Feb 23rd, 11:59 pm 🎥
Don’t forget to sign up for our upcoming social event!! Link in bio✏️

This Hearing Palestine event, April 10th 12pm-1:30 pm is an initial consultation being run by Profs. Tania Salem and Alejandro Paz about the difficulties of speaking about Palestine at UofT. 

We welcome all undergraduate, law, and medical students at the UofT who fell affected by the environment to share their experiences and thoughts, and to make suggestions about how to improve the quality of student life for Palestinians, Arabs and solidarity activists. 

This in-person forum will be a safe space even as we recognize the difficulties that come with speaking about Palestine solidarity. 

Light snack and refreshments will be offered.

Register here:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf0YcRGrnAvmTLPpYKTyqG7JbGp91J7wTtqO3pam0GT38Ksig/viewform

Amid heightened violence back in  2015, the Black-Palestinian Solidarity Campaign released this video, titled “When I See Them, They See Us”. 

“We choose to join one another in resistance not because our struggles are the same but because we each struggle against the formidable forces of structural racism and the carceral and lethal technologies deployed to maintain them. This video intends to interrupt that process – to assert our humanity – and to stand together in an affirmation of life and a commitment to resistance. From Ferguson to Gaza, from Baltimore to Jerusalem, from Charleston to Bethlehem, we will be free.” 

The video features American and Palestinian artists and activists, including Danny Glover, Cornel West, Angela Davis, Alice Walker, LisaGay Hamilton, and Lauryn Hill, Omar Barghouti, Diana Buttu, Noura Erakat, Rashid Khalidi, Sandra Tamari, and Linda Sarsour.

Today, with increased levels of settler colonial violence, we must maintain and strengthen our solidarity. Our liberation is united.

-

Next Thursday:

In a period of increasing settler-colonial violence, renowned Palestinian lawyer Diana Buttu has been traveling through Palestine to keep up with events. Come hear the story that mainstream news isn't covering. Brought to you by Hearing Palestine and UTSPHR! 

Very limited in-person seats available. 

Register NOW at the link in bio. UTSPHR members have priority. 

#Palestine #HearingPalestine #DianaButtu #UofT

📣 Sign up for a Palestine Exhibition hosted by UofT Professor, Dr. Chandni Desai, and UofT students. The exhibition will feature creative works on colonialism, revolution, memory, and third-world internationalism. The event will also host a keynote lecture by Dr. Abdel Razzaq Takriti 🇵🇸

⏰ This event will take place on November 29th, 2022 from 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm in the William Doo Auditorium (45 Willcocks Street)🗓

🌍 Come support your fellow UofT students! We hope to see you there! 🤝

❗LINK TO REGISTER IN BIO❗

‼️AMAZING EVENT‼️

ACLA is excited for the return of our annual soiree - a night of networking followed by a keynote address by an esteemed guest. This year we are honoured to host Omar Shakir, Israel/Palestine Director at Human Rights Watch and author of their recent report on Israel's crimes of apartheid. He will present on how Human Rights Watch reached the apartheid determination and the road forward to dismantling apartheid.

This event is co-hosted with our partners: Human Rights Watch and Hearing Palestine.  

All are welcome to join!

When: November 7, 6:00 PM
Where: University of Toronto, William Doo Auditorium, 45 Willcocks St
